word_mean: 子午线，经线：位于球面体表面的假想线，另见meridianus项下
过天极的地平经圈，与地平圈交于南点和北点。
过天体表面一点和自转轴的平面与其表面相交的弧线。
椭球子午面与椭球面的截线。
南北基准线。指通过地球两个极的大圆。

sentence.Network_en: All places on the same meridian have the same longitude.
sentence.Network_cn: 在同一子午线上的地方都有相同的经度.

sentence.Network_en: He is now at the meridian of his intellectual power.
sentence.Network_cn: 他现在正值智力全盛期.

sentence.Network_en: Terrestrial longitude is measured in degrees east or west of the Greenwich meridian.
sentence.Network_cn: 地球的经度是用格林尼治子午线向东或向西的度数来表示的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French meridien, from Latin meridianum (neuter, used as a noun) 'noon', from medius 'middle' + dies 'day'. The use in astronomy is due to the fact that the sun crosses a meridian at noon

entry.def: A meridian is an imaginary line from the North Pole to the South Pole. Meridians are drawn on maps to help you describe the position of a place.

means.word_mean: 1. an imaginary great circle on the surface of the earth passing through the north and south poles at right angles to the equator;

sentences.sentence: "all points on the same meridian have the same longitude"
